page.title: 15Rural Health.
page.content: Blakesley Reading Room is a building with a long history.It has since been used as a meeting room, a bank, a flat, and, last but not least, a doctor's surgry. The trustees of the reading room, decided it was time to renovate the building and, in particular, to make a little side room into a doctor's consulting room, redecorated and provided with washing facilities. This they have now done at a cost of little over 1000 pounds and paid for it entirely by voluntary donations from people in the village as no grants were forthcoming from the Department of Health, or any other source. While patients have to go to Towcester Medical Centre if they have to be examined, they have a consulting facility on their doorstep. The surgery is used by two practices (5 doctors in all).
